Description: 1. Develop and implement irrigation and fertilization programs.2. Develop and implement pest control programs.3. Develop and implement operational plans for the technical team.4. Monitor the implementation of all operational processes and prepare reports on them.5. Record all implemented operational programs and analyze the data for them.6. Participate in developing new projects that affect the department's work, such as networks, Traps, and integrated pest control.8. Develop plans for networks, including drip irrigation systems, sprinkler systems, and other irrigation systems, and find solutions for current networks.9. Develop a training plan for the technical team, including training on new technologies and techniques for irrigation, fertilization, pest control, and network management.10. Monitor the performance of the technical team and provide feedback and coaching to improve their skills and knowledge.11. Maintain accurate records of all operational processes, including irrigation schedules, fertilization schedules, pest control schedules, and network maintenance schedules.12. Continuously evaluate and improve the efficiency and effectiveness of operational processes, including irrigation, fertilization, pest control, and network management.13. Ensure compliance with all relevant regulations and standards, such as Global GAP and ISO standards.14. Participate in the development of the department's budget and manage expenditures within the allocated budget.15. Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and developments in irrigation, fertilization, pest control, and network management, and apply them to improve the department's operational processes.Job Details
